DOC.HEAD: With PM-US-Panama, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: Here is a roundup of quotes on the U.S. invasion of Panama:
``Yesterday a dictator ruled Panama and today, constitutionally elected leaders govern.'' _ President Bush.

``I'm not going to tell you that the crisis in Panama has been totally resolved. ... But Manuel Noriega, who was yesterday's `maximum leader,' is today's hunted fugitive.'' Secretary of State James A. Baker III.

``We had him spotted several times during the day; we thought we had a pretty good idea where he was at night; we went there and he wasn't there.'' _ Lt. Gen. Tom Kelly, Army deputy chief of staff, on efforts to apprehend Gen. Manuel Antonio Noriega.

``I think we can safely conclude that this ends his career as a drug trafficker. He's not running drugs. He's not running Panama. He's just running. And that's good.'' _ National drug control director William. J. Bennett.

``As a practical matter, we have decapitated him from the dictatorship of this country and he is now a fugitive and will be treated as such. ... We will chase him and we will find him.'' _ Gen. Colin Powell, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.

``It's an action the president determined, and I think under the circumstances Congress will support his position. American troops are in the field and casualties are being taken. Under these circumstances, it's not the proper time for a lot of complicated debate.'' _ House Speaker Thomas S. Foley, D-Wash.

Bush's action was ``a trigger-happy act of gunboat diplomacy that continues our mindless 100-year abuse of small Central American nations.'' _ Rep. Don Edwards, D-Calif., chairman of the House Judiciary subcommittee on the Constitution, who said Bush violated the provision that requires Congress' consent to go to war.
